Topic.Title: The ZTE launch T3 Grand Era

Message.Msg: "I am curious is there statistics re. the percentage of TD-CDMA wireless subscribers vs all wireless subscribers in China?" ==> ZTE Grand Era supports TD-SCDMA used by China Mobile, which has 665 million subscribers and is 3 times more than its closest competitor. China Mobile is at the cusp of upgrading 2G subscribers to 3G. Choice of smartphones supporting TD-SCDMA is limited. Hence Quad-Core Grand Era will provide a great affordable choice to China Mobile subscribers. Won't be suprised China Mobile will provide subsidies as well. "MY understanding is that TD-CDMA network is only deployed in China, not in any other countries. Am I right in this?" ==> TD-SCDMA is owned by the Chinese government and licensed to China Mobile. Other carries in China such as China Telcom and China Unicom do not use TD-SCDMA. "I hope ZTE Grand Era will have a different version going global....any information on this?" Supporting other based band (W-CDMA, etc) is a lot easier than TD-SCDMA.

Topic.Title: Potential Weakness

Topic.Title: Qualcomm APQ8064 Benchmarked in GLBenchmark 2.5

Message.Msg: - In excerpts. "Qualcomm invited us on their campus to take a second look at the APQ8064 based MDP and to test it alongside an ASUS Transformer [Tegra #3] tablet with both running at a very similar resolution (the MDP actually runs at a slightly higher resolution. We then proceeded to test both devices in Kishonti's new GLBenchmark 2.5 and the results were even more astonishing than what we had found during the Qualcomm Snapdragon S4 Benchmarking Day in San Francisco a month ago. In the tests, we tested the Egypt HD benchmark on both devices in both onscreen and offscreen settings. With the Tegra 3 based ASUS Transformer, we got 13 fps onscreen and 9 fps offscreen. We then later confirmed these scores on our own against our Tegra 3 based HTC One X which got the exact same score since both devices run the same processor at the same speed with the same GPU at the same resolution. The Qualcomm APQ8064 MDP, however, blew our minds with its performance. Reporting an onscreen framerate of 37 fps and an offscreen fps of 29fps. This represents an increase of almost 3x compared against the Tegra 3 on the onscreen test and over 3x improvement on the offscreen test. The onscreen test is running the devices at their native (around 720P) resolution while the offscreen test is actually running them at 1080P which is different from GLBenchmark 2.1.5 which ran the offscreen at 720P. Looking at these results, there's no doubt that the secret sauce in the APQ8064 lies within the GPU's sheer power. The Adreno 320 GPU is by far the fastest GPU we've seen in an Android based device and we're interested to see what kind of a GPU experience it can deliver in WindowsRT as well. Qualcomm has been pretty focused on talking about Android, however, we all know that all of the ARM vendors are quietly awaiting the arrival of Windows8RT. Once again, this is not necessarily a production device like the upcoming LG Optimus G, which will be packing the Qualcomm APQ8064 and an MDM9614 LTE modem. We're hopefuly to get one of those APQ8064 enabled devices sometime this fall and to compare shipping devices. So far, Qualcomm has definitely shown that they've put the ball into Nvidias's and Intel's court and challenged them to beat Qualcomm. We should be hearing about Nvidia's and Intel's responses by the end of this year, if we don't, then those companies are probably going to be in trouble." My my my. Jen needs better carnival barking -- and quick! -

Topic.Title: Qualcomm APQ8064 Benchmarked in GLBenchmark 2.5

Message.Msg: - Wow! Qualcomm now has thirteen (13) different 28-nanometer Snapdragon S4's. And twelve (12) of them have wireless radio technology. Right there on the same processor chip. "On-board radio" it's called. Take a look at the Impressive line-up of Qualcomm Snapdragon S4's. Scroll down to the bottom. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snapdragon_(system_on_chip) Thirteen different Snapdragon S4 versions, right boys? And how many nvidia Tegra chips have "on-board" radio technology? Hummm? Or are made in that zippy 28-nanometer process? Hummm? Speak up now, boys. You seem to be quitely whispering into your shoes. ZERO is the correct answer to both questions. Not one Tegra chip has any on-board wireless communication radio. None. And not one Tegra chip is made on the 28-nanometer process. They're all have those nethanderal 40-nanometer pathways. The time is near, right boys? For the Nvidia Board of Directors to pull-the-plug. On Jen's hopelessly late and uncompetitive Tegra folly. And END Jen's failed experiment in making commodity ARM chips. Or one by one, we will watch Qualcomm's fleet of S4 Snapdragons replace the Tegra #3 in everything they're in. She's over, boys. -

Message.Title: Amazon may unveil smartphone
Message.Msg: Amazon Could Launch a Kindle Smartphone on September 6 Friday, August 24, 2012 - by Paul Lilly Amazon has scheduled a press event in California for September 6, 2012, which is two Thursdays from now. Most people assume that's when Amazon will unveil a new batch of Kindle devices, including updated eReaders and possibly even a 10-inch Kindle Fire. There might even be a refreshed 7-inch Kindle Fire in the mix now that competition is heating up with the recent launch of the Nexus 7. But might Amazon also unveil a smartphone? It's a long shot, but while the smart money is on Amazon unveiling tablets and electronic readers, it's not totally inconceivable it will also launch a mobile phone. In fact, you shouldn't be totally shocked if the company does. It was reported by The Wall Street Journal back in July that Amazon was testing a smartphone prototype and expected to mass produce the device by late 2012 or early 2013. Those time frames still work if Amazon announces a phone in early September. It would also steal some thunder away from Apple's upcoming iPhone 5 launch, which most expect will take place on September 12 during a press event of its own. In fact, September looks to be a busy month for smartphones, with Nokia likely to announce a Windows 8 device during a joint event with Microsoft on September 5. Again, Amazon in all likelihood will stick with tablets and readers for its upcoming event, but if so, the question surrounding the e-tailer's smartphone plans becomes a matter of "when," not "if." -----------------------Maybe amzn may use nvidia's kai phone?--------let's see

Message.Title: Why nvidia tegra line loses money
Message.Msg: Nvidia trying to transform from PC to smartphone and tablet processor. It realized its need to spend on r&d. Companies like nokia, hp and dell failed and hence paid the price. From earnings transcript, mentioned that a year ago, they werent name among 48 companies as a potential successful company in its transition. Now it is ranked no. 2!!! Spending on r&d is imperative for their survival. Previous years their sales from tegra sucks. They now just need to ramp up more sales to spread the r&d cost and Bingo.... they will turn this tegra line profitable. Smartphone and tablet may one day become superphone and supertablet. Replacing gaming consoles. Nvidia with its Gpu specialty is in great position to capitalize on gamers needs. Just go check out Dead Trigger, the game, and u will know what i mean. I believe nvda spending huge cash figuring out how to squeeze kepler into phone and tablet. Once nvdia figure it out, nvidia will become a dominant player. Lets all cheer for more design wins for tegra and the profitability will show up.

Message.Title: Apple/NVDA
Message.Msg: At the company's worldwide developer conference in June, Apple brought the Retina display to its Mac lineup, starting with a redesigned MacBook Pro, and updated the rest of its notebook lineup to include the latest Intel (Nasdaq: INTC ) Ivy Bridge processors and NVIDIA (Nasdaq: NVDA ) Kepler graphics. These chips will inevitably make their way throughout the rest of Apple's Mac lineup. Another good reason for MSFT to buy NVDA.

Only if the manufacturing costs is high relative to the ASP (like the S4 Pro) which it is not. Infact they are getting a pretty good Gross Margin for each unit sold. Gross Margin for the idiots is (Selling price - Manufacturing costs) divided by Selling Price - typically this should be above 40% and for the T3 - it is! R&D expenses is a tax deductible expense (R&D credits) for a growing company it's good to see a high level of expense - for the T3 - it's pretty high right now and that's is all GREAT! I want my MTV, my T4+32Keplers, my T4+64Keplers, my T4+32Keplers+LTE, my T3+++LTE, My Tx64Bit - after I get all these - Nvidia engineers you guys can go to Tahiti, Jamaica or wherever you like. Until then use that $3B to accelerate these products and blow the competition away - YOU AIN"T SEEN NOTHING YET _ THIS IS JUST THE BEGINNING! Bashers are all HOT AIR no GREY MATTER in between their EARS.

Topic.Title: Here we go!!!!!

Message.Msg: Monday could be a good day for the markets and NVDA. While design specifications are typically closely held ahead of new product launches, leaks are also rampant, and some reports have claimed that Nvidia's (NVDA) Tegra 3 processor will power the next-generation Kindle Fire. It's always prudent to take these reports with a grain of salt. For instance, there were numerous reports last spring and summer claiming that Nvidia's Tegra 2 would power the original Kindle Fire, but the design win ultimately went to Texas Instruments (TXN). It's likely that Amazon chose TI's OMAP processor because it was able to get better pricing from TI than from Nvidia. Given Amazon's desire to minimize the cost of the tablet, this was probably a good decision on its part. http://seekingalpha.com/article/825401-a-kindle-fire-design-win-could-turbocharge-nvidia-shares

Topic.Title: Why nvidia tegra line loses money

Message.Msg: OVER FOOLS they DOMINATE industries they ramp in!.... The Company holds more than 1,900 issued patents worldwide, including ones covering designs and insights that are essential to modern computing . NVDA hits it big with the Electric Vehical- the car's interior completes its futuristic appeal with a 17-inch touchscreen powered by NVIDIA's (Nasdaq: NVDA ) Tegra 3 processor. Tesla CEO Elon Musk chose NVIDIA's chips because of their ability to render crisp 3-D graphics and maps without draining the car's battery. The Tegra 3 is the first generation that I feel has the capability to catapult Nvidia to the top of the market. This reminds me of the late 90′s when their graphics chips where clearly becoming the best on the market. Many pundits will say that Nvidia doesn’t stand a chance against bigger rivals like Qualcomm which makes the Snapdragon processor, Apple’s A5 chip, or Intel’s Atom chip. The true story is not only does Tegra 3 compete with these, it’s beating them in most benchmark test. And let me warn you Qualcomm, Apple, and Intel, the beating is only going to get worse. I have seen this story before, once Nvidia gets the edge it maintains it. The launch of Tegra 3 accelerated Nvidia’s revenue contribution from its consumer products business, showing a 36% sequential increase last quarter to just over $179 million. Those record sales of Tegra 3 processors last quarter will continue, as Nvidia has had a number of big design wins lately, most notably Google’s Nexus 7, the world’s first $199 quad-core 7-inch tablet, and Microsoft’s Windows RT Surface tablet. So we have two parts to Nvidia now. It’s not just a graphics chip company anymore, as it has a growing mobile computing business as well, which could become larger than its core graphics business in the future The success of Tegra 3 as well as a rebound in its GPU business translated into blowout earnings last quarter, with EPS coming in at 27 cents vs estimates of 15 cents. For the current quarter, the company expects revenue of $1.15 billion to $1.25 billion, the average estimates of analysts was $1.09 billion. Nvidia’s core business is going to be fine, and they will be widely successful in mobile computing as well. Most gamers don’t go to that extreme, but they still want a high performance graphics card for their pc. Nvidia’s current market cap is $9 billion, and they have almost $3.3 billion in cash and no debt. Given the earnings guidance, the company’s EPS should be about $1 for the year, giving it a current p/e of 14. Considering the growth of Tegra 3, and the company’s market share position in graphics, next year earnings could be blowouts, possible $1.50 a share or more for the year. Diversifying- Nvidia knows that tablets and smartphones are only going to become more popular, and who better than to make a central processing unit (CPU), graphics processing unit (GPU), northbridge, southbridge, and memory controller onto one package to go into these devices? Don’t be fooled by the market that don’t get NVDA or understand it. The true story is not only does Tegra 3 compete with these, it’s beating them in most benchmark test. And let me warn you Qualcomm, Apple, and Intel, the beating is only going to get worse. I have seen this story before, once Nvidia gets the edge it maintains it. The R's GeForce graphics chip fires up the 4.2-inch screen with a resolution of 480x800 pixels, and there's 8GB of internal memory for storing 1080p high-definition video. The 5-megapixel camera shoots 720p high-definition footage.

Topic.Title: Why nvidia tegra line loses money

Message.Msg: RAMPING RAMPING! manufacturer reported second quarter 2013 earnings that beat Wall Street estimates. Revenue for the quarter came in at $1.04 billion. This was higher than last year’s revenue which was reported at $924.0 million and analysts expectations of $1.01 billion. Worst is over!- On the profit front, NVIDIA reported non-GAAP earnings oft 27 cents per share compared to 16 cents per share for the same quarter last year. Analysts forecast earnings of 22 cents per share. Better outlook- Generally speaking, the company’s chips sales outside of the PC market appears to be boosting revenue. Sales in this area will likely be critical to the company going forward, as global PC sales appear to be waning, so says noted research firm Gartner. NVIDIA's Tegra series chips will be featured in both Microsoft's (Nasdaq: MSFT) upcoming Surface Windows RT tablet PC and are already featured in Google's (Nasdaq: GOOG) Nexus 7 tablet. In addition, investors might keep an eye on new cloud computing technologies, which NVIDIA announced at its recent GPI Technology Conference SALES RECORDS- "Our investments in mobile computing and visual computing are both paying off," said Jen-Hsun Huang, president and chief executive officer of NVIDIA. "Tegra has achieved record sales as tablets come into their own. Our GPU business made strong gains in a weak market, boosted by our breakthrough Kepler architecture. Looking ahead, we're optimistic, as our investments position us right at the center of the fastest growing segments of computing." FUTURE PROOF- Nvidia’s Grid and VGX cloud graphics processors enable gamer-grade or professional-grade graphics capabilities on absolutely any device, including desktops, laptops, tablets or even smartphones. 100% - Without doubts, cloud graphics processing technologies are among the most important technologies Nvidia has ever developed. However, it will take some time before they will be adopted by the mass market. The key technologies powering the new platform are Nvidia GeForce Grid GPUs with dedicated ultra-low-latency streaming technology and cloud graphics software. Together, they fundamentally change the economics and experience of cloud gaming, enabling gaming-as-a-service providers to operate scalable data centers at costs that are in line with those of movie-streaming services. Gaikai will be the first Nvidia customer to adopt GeForce Grid MULTI MEDIA- Fast streaming technology reduces server latency to as little as 10 milliseconds by capturing and encoding a game frame in a single pass. The GeForce Grid platform uses fast-frame capture, concurrent rendering and single-pass encoding to achieve ultra-fast game streaming. The R's GeForce graphics chip fires up the 4.2-inch screen with a resolution of 480x800 pixels, and there's 8GB of internal memory for storing 1080p high-definition video. The 5-megapixel camera shoots 720p high-definition footage.

Topic.Title: Jury reaches a verdict on Apple/Samsung

Message.Msg: While you are "rolling on the floor laughing" you might want to go back and read the article. The design patent was not infringed. Samsung was found liable for copying trade dress....and you can't patent or trademark a color as Christian Loboutin recently found out. In any event, enough education for the uneducated, Samsung will post bond, make noise about appealing to the CAFC and settle in a few months for 700-800 million

Topic.Title: Jury reaches a verdict on Apple/Samsung

Message.Msg: - "After just 21 hours of deliberation, the jury has reached a verdict in the Apple-Samsung patent trial, a landmark case that is set to change the way we look at competition in the mobile market. It’s a Decisive Win for Apple, with the jury awarding damages of $1,049,343,540 to Apple The jury found Samsung infringed many of Apple’s utility and design patents, particularly with regard to the nearly 20 phones that Apple had called into question. In addition, the jury found that in most cases, Samsung’s patent infringements were Knowing and Willful. It also found that Apple’s patents were Valid." Pay to the Order of Apple. $1,049,343,540 Unless the Judge decides to Treble part or All of it. For being deliberate and willful patent theft. Then the damages will be More, of course. Much more. The Judge will also decide which Samsung cellphones and tablets should be injoined from being sold in these fine United States of America. Until they are re-designed so they no longer infringe on Apple's valid and enforceable patents. Impact on nvidia: Likely a suspension in orders from Samsung for a while. Maybe a looooong while, boys. While Samsung redesigns all their infringing cellphones and tablets. -

Topic.Title: Jury reaches a verdict on Apple/Samsung

Message.Msg: - So Best? Samsung being enjoined by the Judge from selling their products in the U.S.A will have the knock-on effect on nvidia as Samsung's parts orders go to zero. For a while. So look for diminished nvidia revenue, boys. For a while. -
